p: We noticed that the repellent activity increased with a prolonged exposure time and varied depending on the tested sample. Thus, both populations of Clinopodium nepeta subsp. glandulosum (CNG 1 and CNG 2) had a prominent repellency effect against both insects (PR > 80%, after 2 h), while C. nepeta subsp. nepeta displayed a significantly low activity (PR < 60%, after 2 h), ( F df2,11 = 11.3; p = 0.003 for T. confusum and F df2,11 = 23.5; p < 0.00 for S. zeamais).
